dublin_core.dcvalue: County lines is the term used for the proliferating mobile phone lines used by gangs to infiltrate county towns where a profitable drug market is identified The National Crime Agency reports that 88 of police areas in England and Wales have either an established or emerging County Lines problem in their area With an estimated 46 053 aged 10 18 years in England in a gang the activities of gangs and County Lines have a devastating impact on young people vulnerable adults and local communities Young people engaged in County Lines activities are at hugely increased risk of child sexual exploitation criminal conviction violence drug addiction and trafficking It is essential that healthcare staff receive a high standard of training as seen in other organisations and that time is taken to try to identify and intervene with those at risk of gang exploitation at an early stage to try to prevent significant harm
Made available in DSpace on 2020-06-08T14:26:47Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2-11-30
County lines: how gang crime is affecting our young people.
